The Internal Traffic Statistics feature: The Internal Traffic Statistics feature logs pageviews, IP addresses, and other basic anonymous user data into the database.
Purge the Internal Traffic Statistics da: Purge the Internal Traffic Statistics data
Internal Traffic Statistics logs pagevie: Internal Traffic Statistics logs pageviews, IP addresses, and other basic anonymous user data into the database and provides reports for the dashboard. When the feature is disabled, the data is not written to the database.
Timezone to log pageviews in. Changing t: Timezone to log pageviews in. Changing the timezone won't update the existing data. If you change the timezone without erasing the existing data, reports can potentially display incorrect times for previously logged days.
Determines the duration for which traffi: Determines the duration for which traffic statistics data should be stored in the database. When the set period expires, the corresponding data is automatically purged from the database. Set to 0 or empty to retain records forever.
Automatically ignores known bots using t: Automatically ignores known bots using the detection library.
Requests from these addresses will be ig: Requests from these addresses will be ignored in statistics.
Enter one path or pattern per row to ign: Enter one path or pattern per row to ignore matching URLs.
